meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to give birth to offspring.
meanings.sent1: The barren land remained whelpless, unable to bring forth life.
meanings.sent2: The infertile soil was whelpless, incapable of nurturing any plants.
meanings.sent3: The empty bird's nest looked whelpless, as if it could never hold any eggs.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed whelpless, unable to deliver rain to the thirsty earth.
meanings.sent5: The broken clock appeared whelpless, frozen in time and unable to tick.

meanings.definition: Without the characteristics or qualities of a young animal.
meanings.sent1: The old tree stood whelpless, lacking the fresh green leaves of youth.
meanings.sent2: The worn-out toy looked whelpless, missing the playful energy of a puppy.
meanings.sent3: The faded painting seemed whelpless, as if it had lost its vibrant colors of youth.
meanings.sent4: The rusty bike appeared whelpless, no longer embodying the speed of a young colt.
meanings.sent5: The wilted flower seemed whelpless, drooping without the vigor of a young bud.
